intro: Parietaria praetermissa, commonly known as the common wall-rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known plants like cabbages and mustards. This herbaceous perennial typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in the spring. The plant has serrated leaves and is often found growing on rocky or disturbed soils.
